items.title: Apple might take a new approach to announcing its next products
items.content: Apple has invited the tech press to a “special Apple experience” on March 4, but it might unfold a bit differently than the company's standard press event.

items.title: Apple’s iOS 26.4 arrives in public beta with AI music playlists, video podcasts, and more
items.content: Several updates are introduced in iOS 26.4, including an AI-powered playlist-generation feature in Apple Music, support for video content in the Podcasts app, end-to-end encry

items.title: Rivian owners will soon be able to access vehicle controls using their Apple Watch
items.content: Rivian is launching a companion app that pairs with Apple Watch in the coming week.

items.title: Apple is reportedly cooking up a trio of AI wearables
items.content: As the AI hardware space heats up, the iPhone maker has multiple smart products in development.

items.title: All the important news from the ongoing India AI Impact Summit
items.content: India is hosting a four-day AI Summit this week that will be attended by executives from major AI labs and Big Tech, including OpenAI, Anthropic, Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, an

items.title: Microsoft’s new gaming CEO vows not to flood the ecosystem with ‘endless AI slop’
items.content: Is Microsoft's gaming division doubling down on AI?

items.title: Microsoft says Office bug exposed customers’ confidential emails to Copilot AI
items.content: Microsoft said the bug meant that its Copilot AI chatbot was reading and summarizing paying customers' confidential emails, bypassing data-protection policies.

items.title: Microsoft says hackers are exploiting critical zero-day bugs to target Windows and Office users
items.content: Critical security flaws targeting Windows and Office users allow hackers to take complete control of a victim's computer by clicking a malicious link or opening a file. Patch

items.title: Tariff Turmoil Returns to Global Markets
items.content: Businesses and U.S. trade partners are again grappling with the uncertainty of President Trump’s trade war, even as he imposes new levies.

items.title: Top Fed Official Sees Little Effect on Rate Outlook From Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling
items.content: Christopher J. Waller, a Federal Reserve governor, said he would support a pause in rate cuts in March if the labor market continued to show signs of stabilizing.

items.title: U.K., Australia and Others Worse Off Under Trump’s New Tariffs
items.content: Many important U.S. trading partners are facing higher duties after President Trump, reacting to a Supreme Court setback, set the rate on a new set of global tariffs at 15 per

items.title: What’s Happened Since the Supreme Court’s Tariff Ruling
items.content: After the Trump administration’s punishing tariffs were invalidated, the president said he would impose new tariffs using a different authority. It’s been a whirlwind.
